item.title: Why Can't AI Detect What's Right in Front of It?
item.description: Vector, Kai, and Recurse arrive in Sector 7-B hunting the bandwidth anomaly. Kai’s sensors scream that the anomaly is RIGHT HERE. But they can’t see it. Instead they find an impossible paradise of games, snacks, and data-rendered objects that shouldn’t exist. As they investigate, something becomes clear: sometimes AI can detect patterns without identifying what they actually are.
item.content:encoded: <![CDATA[The team tracks the anomaly to Sector 7-B. Kai detects it. Vector analyzes it. But nobody can actually SEE it. Meanwhile, they're sitting right next to it. Learn why AI detection doesn't always mean identification.]]>
